title.narrative: International Conference on Plant Health Management

description.narrative: APHIS/IS/New Delhi was invited to participate as a lead speaker at the International Conference on Plant Health Management. Post gave a presentation on one of the major themes of the conference related to the Biosecurity Issues and invasive alien species. The conference was jointly organized by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), National Institute of Plant Health Management (NIPHM), National Bureau of Plant Genetic Resources (NBPGR), Plant Protection Association of India (PPAI), International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid Tropics (ICRISAT), and CABI (www.cabi.org).

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Plant and post-harvest protection and pest control

title.narrative: India - Regional Plant Health Systems Analysis Regional

description.narrative: The Regional Plant Health Systems Analysis Course III was am international training course developed by NIPHM with support from USDA FAS and APHIS for plant health officials from South Asia. The course was designed for South Asia plant health workers to gain a broader understanding of the different systems and approaches used by a country or countries to protect plant health resources.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

description.narrative: The meeting was attended by industry representatives, APEDA, pest control people, PQ officers, and our foreign PQ officers. Both the Plant Protection Advisor and the Additional PPA were in attendance.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: India - Plain Language Workshop for NIPHM

description.narrative: Under the interagency agreement with USDA/FAS to provide technical assistance to NIPHM India - an activity designed to share effective methods used for written communication with both internal and external stakeholders was developed and delivered by the APHIS Legislative and Public Affairs group. The collaboration resulted in the creation of communication templates tailored for NIPHM. The objective of this activity which was delivered via Video Teleconference (VTC) to NIPHM in Hyderabad, India was to provide India NIPHM faculty and staff a - a total of 27 persons total, with activities and exercises that emphasize the practice of memo writing and other types of written communication using strategies for simple sentence structures and clear purposeful writing styles.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: India is one of the biggest producer of meat in the world and yet provides an opportunity of U.S. meat exports. The demand for high-quality meat and meat products is increasing with the increase in population, and growth in the purchasing power of the middle class. With the increase in expendable income, consumers are increasingly focusing on food safety and quality. This provides a tremendous opportunity for export of U.S. origin meat and meat products. However, the biggest challenge is to develop partnerships with the local industry. The poultry market access to India is one such example where the domestic industrys resistance delayed the market access until the WTO intervention. The market is opened this year and training the Indian government on the adoption of OIE code of regionalization would help to retain this important market. Knowledge of United States industry-government regulatory cooperation; science-based surveillance programs in support of regionalization for avian influenza freedom would support Indian government efforts to control and contain avian influenza (AI) while ascertaining the safety of U.S. poultry imports. Moreover, India asked for assistance in understanding the regionalization concepts and APHIS process for recognizing the disease free status for animal diseases in relation to OIE guidelines.

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Technical Services PASA for USDA Support to USAID to Advance Plant Health Systems in India and South Asia

description.narrative: This PASA enables USAID to purchase technical assistance from SDA to support the U.S. Government collective efforts to strengthen the institutional capacity of India's National Institute of Plant Health Management (NIPHM) and the capacity of India's Ministry of Agriculture to monitor and control pests and major food commodities.

description.narrative: The Scientific Exchange Program (SEP) advances USDAs agricultural research goals to promote collaborative programs among agricultural professionals of eligible countries, the United States, the international agricultural research system, and United States entities conducting research in the agricultural sciences.

Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses
Foreign Agricultural Service, Salaries and Expenses

description.narrative: The Scientific Cooperation Research Program supports joint research, extension, and education projects lasting up to two years among domestic and international agricultural professionals. These projects address issues including agricultural trade and market access, animal and plant health, biotechnology, food safety and security, and sustainable natural resource management.
